mission.title: Our purpose
mission.text:
Our goal is to provide every family a place of comfort, support and sharing.

Everyday, condolence messages, incredible memories and transcendent testimonials are shared using InMemori. They remind us that sharing our experiences with one another, seeing our loved one through someone else's eyes is life-giving, in a moment of what seems like vast emptiness.

We have dedicated ourselves to providing a free service that families can use to mourn, to heal, and to celebrate. 

Just in the past year, we have supported 30,000 people. With InMemori, we hope to reveal the essentials of life, celebrating the moments that mark us, those that make us human.

story.title: How we came about
text: Clémentine decides to support grieving families as they organize the funeral services. While simultaneously working as the CMO of a French publicly traded company, Clémentine spent time with families who've suffered a loss to best understand how she could comfort them.
Constance joins the team. She speaks with families everyday, answering their questions and helping them make full use of InMemori.
Families and their loved ones, grateful for InMemori and its role in their healing, become its ambassadors. Through word of mouth, InMemori was able to comfort 30,000 people in their moment of loss.
InMemori is selected to participate in an acceleration program in Silicon Valley, The Refiners. InMemori goes global.
Offices in Paris and NYC are opened. The team consists of 5 people dedicated to fulfilling InMemori's purpose.

values.title: Our values
values.text: Our purpose is to reveal the essentials of life. We seek to create a collective consciousness through memory.
items: We are inherently conscious of the complexity of this period for families and the need for utmost delicacy. You are at the heart of InMemori's mission.
InMemori provides a safe space for people to share in, protecting words, photos and memories from uninvited eyes.
InMemori is for all ages, cultures and creeds. Loss and love touch us all, so should InMemori.

press.title: Press
press.text: We invite journalists to contact InMemori's PR team for all interview and information requests. Media contact : Brunswick, Hugues Boëton +33 153.968.383 / +33 679.992.715 InMemori@brunswickgroup.com

contact.title: Any questions?
contact.text: If you have any questions or need any help using our service, please don't hesitate to contact Constance or our support team, emailing us at contact@InMemori.com. We will respond in less than 24 hours.
items:
72 Allen St.
New York, NY 10002
United States

team.title: Who are we?
team.text: At the heart of InMemori is a team that unites beautiful, soulful energy to create life out of loss.

items.intro: This is a profound mission that puts everything in its rightful place.

items.name: Constance de Vernejoul
items.bio: A NEOMA Business School graduate, Constance worked at L'Oréal, in PR and international communications. First to have joined InMemori, she's held the hands of 300 families and seeks to accompany countless more.
items.intro: I wanted to be there for others during a period in their lives when people feel profoundly alone.

items.name: Marly  Diallo
items.role: Head of Business Development & Operations, France
items.bio: Having finished her studies at ESSEC Business School, Marly was a senior asset manager at Unibail-Rodamco, where she met InMemori's fearless leader, Clémentine. She then joined Walt Group as a project manager, then the global luxury group Kering.
items.intro: The effort we put in everyday lets us contribute to creating strong, resilient communities.

items.name: Eva Kerner
items.bio: A UCSB, Sciences Po and LSE grad, Eva worked in PR and digital strategy in Paris. In SF, she worked with Fabernovel to develop a corporate innovation lab in the insurance space. Eva heard Clémentine's pitch in SF and the rest is history.
items.intro: It's said that we die twice. Once when we take our last breath, and the second, when someone utters out name for the last time. With InMemori, I can help make sure people's names, memories and stories live on.

items.name: Louis Grellet
items.bio: Engineer and entrepreneur, Louis was Allopneus' CTO and CEO at Flooz.
items.intro: Mourning is a moment in life where technology is absent. Therefore, it's a technical challenge that I'd like to solve.
